title: (x) Sign & Graphic Solutions Made Simple - ITC Eras {James}
content:
This is a little bit like that "Tree Buckets" font (Trebuchet MS) but the a is round ETC...   
Whats this one?   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054725im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69060.jpg)
author: planet_embroidery

comments.content: [Eras](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516054725/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/itc-eras/regular/testdrive.html?s=Sign+%26+Graphic+Solutions&p=60) with an alternate, likely predigital, a.
I think the 'a' is made from a 'q' or 'g' -- I don't think there is a 'pre-digital' 'a', but I would like to know if anyone knows of such a character.
